# PKEraserTool

**Structure**

A tool for erasing previously drawn content in a canvas view.

## Declaration

```swift
struct PKEraserTool
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKEraserTool-swift.struct] object supports the deletion of content from a [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKCanvasView] object. The eraser tool’s type determines whether the canvas removes entire items or just the portion of an item that it touches.

Create an eraser tool programmatically or display a [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKToolPicker] object and let the user select the eraser. Assign the resulting object to the [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKCanvasView/tool-6str6] property of your [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKCanvasView] object. The canvas uses any subsequent touch sequences to erase content on the canvas.

## Creating an eraser tool

- **init(_:)**: Creates an eraser tool object that removes objects wholly or partially from a canvas view.
- **init(_:width:)**: Creates an eraser tool object with the specified width.

## Getting the eraser type

- **eraserType**: The behavior adopted by the eraser when deleting content.
- **PKEraserTool.EraserType**: Constants that indicate the behavior of the eraser.

## Specifying the width

- **width**: The width of the eraser.

## Using reference types

- **PKEraserToolReference**: A tool for erasing previously drawn content in a canvas view.

## Tools

- **Configuring the PencilKit tool picker**: Incorporate a custom PencilKit tool picker with a variety of system and custom tools into a drawing app.
- **PKToolPicker**: A tool palette that displays a selection of drawing tools and colors for tools that a person can choose from.
- **PKInkingTool**: A structure that defines the drawing characteristics (width, color, pen style) to use when drawing lines on a canvas view.
- **PKLassoTool**: A tool for selecting stroked lines and shapes in a canvas view.
- **PKTool**: An interface adopted by drawing and writing tools used by a canvas view.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- PKTool
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
